Posts.Content: Mehimnthem wrote: Hi, I feel very tearful and mixed up whilst writing this. I am 40 years old, married and have two children 12 years n 8 years. This all started last Friday night 11.8.12. In brief i was driving along the road when somehow I discovered a lump. It is on my left side somewhere between my breast and armpit. I had never felt it before, but without sounding irresponsible, had I ever really checked myself properly or regularly enough to find it. I was a little concerned. Completely out of character for me. My mind started running a bit wayward, thinking all sorts n I had a few secret tears. My two children were in the car. They knew nothing n saw nothing. My husband was home. I had no intention of telling him anything at that stage as instantly he would think the worst. i went to work the next day as usual. I went to a local drop in centre on the morning. As it happens the doctor i seen was a skin specialist. After examining me, and my request for honesty and his true opinion, I was told the following; That the lump which is approx 2inchs by 1/2" in his opinion was one of two things. A piece of fatty tissue or a breast lump, but he said he was swaying more towards the lump. Just like me he couldn't quite decide if it was in the armpit or attached to my breast. Obviously I fully understand that this was not any kind of diagnosis only his opinion. He said as his job was a skin specialist, he deals with all sorts of irrregularities n mine did not feel like fatty tissue. On the other hand he was by no way telling me that It was a cancerous lump either. He treated me professionally and exactly as I had asked. I was advised to see my own GP first thing Monday and ask for an urgent referral to the hospital. I did just that and now have my appointment which is this coming Tues. (that is the day of the clinic each week). I would describe myself as very level headed and also independent. My husband is level headed but to say he is a pessimist is an under statement. I left grateful for his honesty. Understandably I was concerned but felt as he was so honest I had little to worry about. I told my hubby when I got home on his advice. Well, well well well well! Since then it has been one of the most emotional mixed up weeks of my life. He is completely convinced the absolute worst thing is inevitable. I understand his worry, quite obviously, it is happening to me after all. The thing is, because he is so so bad, my mind keeps going off in a tangent, I keep telling him all will be fine, all of it is simply precaution. I am working so hard at trying to protect him but inside I am getting more n more worried. Then I pull myself together and feel so so guilty for feeling sorry for myself. I almost feel like a fraud, as how do I know I have anything to be worried about. There are so many people who a million times worse of then I am. How dare I? Yet then secretly I cry myself to sleep!!! I am beating myself up in so many directions I feel like I am going crazy!!!! Is this normal? Log in to post a reply
